meanings.definition: A person or thing that erects or builds.
meanings.sent1: The erector constructed a new house in our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The erector used his tools to build a sturdy fence.
meanings.sent3: The erector accidentally built a sandcastle instead of a sculpture.
meanings.sent4: His role as an erector of dreams made him a sought-after architect.
meanings.sent5: The erector's skill in building bridges amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A muscle that straightens a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The erector muscle in his back helped him stand up straight.
meanings.sent2: She felt a twinge in her erector after lifting the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The erector muscle decided to take a break, causing him to slouch.
meanings.sent4: His erector muscle was as strong as steel, supporting him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Stretching exercises can help strengthen the erector muscles in your spine.

meanings.definition: A type of crane used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The erector lifted the heavy beams with precision using the crane.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew relied on the erector to move materials to higher floors.
meanings.sent3: The erector crane had a playful beep whenever it moved.
meanings.sent4: The erector crane stood tall like a giant metal bird in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The erector crane's hydraulic system allowed for smooth and efficient operation.
